hints.content: The mass of a superhero book is $\greenD{200}$ grams.
The mass of a dragon book is $\maroonD{310}$ grams.

We can find the total mass of the books by adding the mass of the superhero book $(\greenD{200\text{ g}})$ to the mass of the dragon book $(\maroonD{310\text{ g}})$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the top rectangle is labeled Total mass. The bottom rectangle is divided into 2 parts. The shorter left part is labeled 200 grams. The longer right part is labeled 310 grams. A curved bracket across the shorter left part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Superhero book. A curved bracket across the longer right part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Dragon book. !

hints.content: The mass of the books is $510$ grams.

question.content:
Nikita borrows $1$ superhero book and $1$ dragon book from the library. 

The mass of the superhero book is shown below.

[[☃ image 1]]

The dragon book has a mass of $310$ grams.

**What is the mass of the books Nikita borrowed combined?**
  
[[☃ input-number 3]] grams

options.alt: A hanging scale weighing a superhero book has 6 major tick marks. First major tick mark is labeled 0 and fourth major tick mark is labeled 150. Second, third, fifth, and sixth major tick marks are unlabeled. There are 4 minor unlabeled tick marks between every 2 major tick marks. The mass of the superhero book on the scale is at the fifth major unlabeled tick mark. !
